page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF BLOCK
page.content: The block is mainly of arable and grazing land with transport lines to London and Southampton via the railway and M3. The area is dominated by the village of Hook which has been designated an area for planned housing growth despite local resistance. Living standards in the area are high with low people to house ratios, particularly in Hook. Housing is mainly estates of two storey detatched and semi-detatched houses. Because of good transport links employment is generally outside the area but some industry, taking advantage of the transport lines,is found on an industrial estate in Hook. Poor commercial and leisure facilities in the area means that the focus of recreation and shopping is also outside the area in Basingstoke, Fleet or Hartley Wintney.
